project_description: A Flutter application demonstrating state management using the Cubit pattern. The app includes two main screens: a home screen displaying a list of items and a details screen showing details of a selected item.
architecture_overview: The project follows a layered architecture with a clear separation of concerns. State management is handled using the Cubit pattern. The UI layer consists of Flutter widgets organized by screens and components. Business logic is encapsulated within Cubits, and models represent data structures.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen : Open App
HomeScreen -> HomeCubit : Fetch Items
HomeCubit -> HomeState : Emit HomeLoaded
HomeScreen -> DetailsScreen : Navigate to Details
DetailsScreen -> DetailsCubit : Fetch Details
DetailsCubit -> DetailsState : Emit DetailsLoaded
@enduml
state_management_flow: State is managed using the Cubit pattern. Each screen has its own Cubit that handles the state logic. The Cubit emits states which the UI listens to and rebuilds accordingly.
navigation_flow: The app uses named routes for navigation. The main.dart file sets up the initial routes for the HomeScreen and DetailsScreen. Navigation is handled using Navigator.push and Navigator.pop to move between screens.
